label: 松浦党
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: The [Matsura-tō] was a group of petty military families with elenth-century roots in the Matsuura region of northern Hizen Province in Kyushu, and the object of their piratical raids was Korea.  [They] became notorious as a band of villains" who sailed abroad to "destroy people's dwellings and plunder their property" (p. 239). [肥前、九州]"
